description: A large bull stands poised near the entrance to a bullfighting arena, looking out at a matador and a distant crowd. Several other bulls are visible behind a wooden fence, seemingly watching the scene unfolding. The perspective places the viewer within the bulls' environment, suggesting their observation of the human activity. This setup implies a reversal of roles, positioning the animals as spectators or judges of the performance. The scenario satirizes the ritualistic aspects of the event by giving agency and commentary to the bulls.
caption: “Bring back his ear.”
